top_categories.workout_context: Grinduro's mixed dirt roads with technical singletrack forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 60 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Grinduro's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before race day.
7,800ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
60 miles on mixed dirt roads with technical singletrack burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Grinduro, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
130ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Grinduro, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on mixed dirt roads with technical singletrack. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
7,800ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Grinduro. Train it until it feels boring.
Base fitness for Grinduro. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Smooth pedaling at 60 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.

race_overlay.heat: Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Grinduro. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Grinduro’s 60 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Grinduro. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Grinduro demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed dirt roads with technical singletrack sections — pushes gravel bike limits at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 60 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 60 miles of mixed dirt roads with technical singletrack sections — pushes gravel bike limits in Multi-Location Global Series.
